Package io.atomix.core

Class AtomixBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.cluster.AtomixClusterBuilder
      • io.atomix.core.AtomixBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<AtomixCluster>
    public class AtomixBuilder
extends AtomixClusterBuilder
    Builder for Atomix instance.

    This builder is used to configure an Atomix instance programmatically. To create a new builder, use one of the Atomix.builder() static methods. 

       
   AtomixBuilder builder = Atomix.builder();
    The instance is configured by calling the with* methods on this builder. Once the instance has been configured, call build() to build the instance: 
       
   Atomix atomix = Atomix.builder()
     .withMemberId("member-1")
     .withAddress("localhost", 5000)
     .build();
    Backing the builder is an AtomixConfig which is loaded when the builder is initially constructed. To load a configuration from a file, use Atomix.builder(String).

      • withManagementGroup

        public AtomixBuilder withManagementGroup​(ManagedPartitionGroup systemManagementGroup)
        Sets the system management partition group.

        The system management group must be configured for stateful instances. This group will be used to store primitive and transaction metadata and coordinate primary elections for replication protocols. 

           
   Atomix atomix = Atomix.builder()
     .withManagementGroup(RaftPartitionGroup.builder("system")
       .withNumPartitions(1)
       .build())
     .build();

        The configured partition group is replicated on whichever nodes define them in this configuration. That is, this node will participate in whichever partition group is provided to this method.

        The management group can also be configured in atomix.conf under the management-group key.

        Parameters:
        systemManagementGroup - the system management partition group
        Returns:
        the Atomix builder

      • withPartitionGroups

        public AtomixBuilder withPartitionGroups​(ManagedPartitionGroup... partitionGroups)
        Sets the primitive partition groups.

        The primitive partition groups represent partitions that are directly accessible to distributed primitives. To use partitioned primitives, at least one node must be configured with at least one data partition group. 

           
   Atomix atomix = Atomix.builder()
     .withPartitionGroups(PrimaryBackupPartitionGroup.builder("data")
       .withNumPartitions(32)
       .build())
     .build();
        The partition group name is used to uniquely identify the group when constructing primitive instances. Partitioned primitives will reference a specific protocol and partition group within which to replicate the primitive.

        The configured partition groups are replicated on whichever nodes define them in this configuration. That is, this node will participate in whichever partition groups are provided to this method.

        The partition groups can also be configured in atomix.conf under the partition-groups key.

        Parameters:
        partitionGroups - the partition groups
        Returns:
        the Atomix builder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the partition groups are null

      • withPartitionGroups

   Atomix atomix = Atomix.builder()

      • addPartitionGroup

        public AtomixBuilder addPartitionGroup​(ManagedPartitionGroup partitionGroup)
        Adds a primitive partition group.

        The provided group will be added to the list of already configured partition groups. The primitive partition groups represent partitions that are directly accessible to distributed primitives. To use partitioned primitives, at least one node must be configured with at least one data partition group. 

           
   Atomix atomix = Atomix.builder()
     .withPartitionGroups(PrimaryBackupPartitionGroup.builder("data")
       .withNumPartitions(32)
       .build())
     .build();
        The partition group name is used to uniquely identify the group when constructing primitive instances. Partitioned primitives will reference a specific protocol and partition group within which to replicate the primitive.

        The configured partition groups are replicated on whichever nodes define them in this configuration. That is, this node will participate in whichever partition groups are provided to this method.

        The partition groups can also be configured in atomix.conf under the partition-groups key.

        Parameters:
        partitionGroup - the partition group to add
        Returns:
        the Atomix builder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the partition group is null

      • withClusterId

        public AtomixBuilder withClusterId​(String clusterId)
        Description copied from class: AtomixClusterBuilder
        Sets the cluster identifier.

        The cluster identifier is used to verify intra-cluster communication is taking place between nodes that are intended to be part of the same cluster, e.g. if multicast discovery is used. It only needs to be configured if multiple Atomix clusters are running within the same network.

        Overrides:
        withClusterId in class AtomixClusterBuilder
        Parameters:
        clusterId - the cluster identifier
        Returns:
        the cluster builder

      • withMulticastEnabled

        public AtomixBuilder withMulticastEnabled()
        Description copied from class: AtomixClusterBuilder
        Enables multicast communication.

        Multicast is disabled by default. This method must be called to enable it. Enabling multicast enables the use of the BroadcastService.

        Overrides:
        withMulticastEnabled in class AtomixClusterBuilder
        Returns:
        the cluster builder
        See Also:
        AtomixClusterBuilder.withMulticastAddress(Address)

      • setReachabilityThreshold

        public AtomixBuilder setReachabilityThreshold​(int threshold)
        Description copied from class: AtomixClusterBuilder
        Sets the reachability failure detection threshold.

        Reachability of cluster members is determined using a phi-accrual failure detector. The reachability threshold is the phi threshold after which a peer will be determined to be unreachable.

        Overrides:
        setReachabilityThreshold in class AtomixClusterBuilder
        Parameters:
        threshold - the reachability failure detection threshold
        Returns:
        the cluster builder

      • withReachabilityTimeout

        public AtomixBuilder withReachabilityTimeout​(Duration timeout)
        Description copied from class: AtomixClusterBuilder
        Sets the reachability failure timeout.

        The reachability timeout determines the maximum time after which a member will be marked unreachable if heartbeats have failed.

        Overrides:
        withReachabilityTimeout in class AtomixClusterBuilder
        Parameters:
        timeout - the reachability failure timeout
        Returns:
        the cluster builder

      • build

        public Atomix build()
        Builds a new Atomix instance.

        The returned instance will be configured with the initial builder configuration plus any overrides that were made via the builder. The returned instance will not be running. To start the instance call the Atomix.start() method: 

           
   Atomix atomix = Atomix.builder()
     .withMemberId("member-1")
     .withAddress("localhost", 5000)
     .build();
   atomix.start().join();
        Specified by:
        build in interface Builder<AtomixCluster>
        Overrides:
        build in class AtomixClusterBuilder
        Returns:
        a new Atomix instance
